content.description: Climb up the corner into the face following the obvious flake. The crux is at the top.
content.protection: Build a TR anchor at the top. There is a tree directly over the route.
content.location: It is in the center of the main cliff.

content.description:
The best line on the cliff, this route surmounts the overhanging central prow. Slightly overhanging and quite sustained over its short length, it is harder than it looks from the ground. The climbing is really fun as it packs a lot of variety: bouldery face moves, laybacks, and jams. It is worthy of 2.5 stars, really. Some holds may not be long for this world.

 Consider the name and grade a placeholder. I am happy to update them if anyone previous name/FA info.
content.protection: TR off the big trees ~20 feet from the cliff edge. Alternatively, there is a small crack next to the bolt at the top of the route that would take a couple finger-sized pieces. Don't trust the bolt. It could be led if one were so inclined, but I'd be hesitant given the route's suspect rock and short stature.
content.location: Start below the overhanging prow matched on a jug pinch.

content.description: Restoration climbs a fantastic seam with just enough holds to get you to the top. The low start is harder, but we stood on the block at the base, stepped out left, and traversed into the seam. Liebacks, good footwork, and jams will get you to the top. This might take a lead on gear if the pro is placed after you've used the hold with your hand.
content.protection: A TR. There is a small tree or the bolt and crack at the top ledge might be able to be used as well.
content.location: Find the obvious seam around the corner from Revival.

content.description: I wish this was longer. Climb a fist to OW crack or layback this striking feature.

This is a series of cliffs way out in Nature Valley. They range from 15' to about 25' tall.Â  We found an old rope, one bolt, and a nut probably from about 20 years ago or more. The two routes that are logged here are the obvious lines on the larger cliff and were likely climbed in the past. There are additional routes here and some boulders scattered nearby.

 There is an arete between Revival and Restoration with a bolt at the top (TR) that is a primo line that needs attention.
